intro: Erigeron tenellus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom from late spring to early fall. Erigeron tenellus is often found in prairie habitats and is considered a valuable plant for pollinators.
